Methods

addEventListener

  • addEventListener(type: string, listener: any, scope?: object): any
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:59

    Add event listener. This method has to be used to listen for specific events raised by the wrapped player. Generic video element events and OnePlayer events (see PlayerEvents) are triggered and delivered through the video element.

    Parameters

    • type: string

      the event type/name as specified by the wrapped player.

    • listener: any

      callback method when the event fires.

    • Optional scope: object

      context of the listener so it can be removed properly.

    Returns any

enableLastMediaSettingsCaching

  • enableLastMediaSettingsCaching(enable: boolean, key?: string): any
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:49

    Enable/disable caching last media settings such as last audio and text selected language and text tracks state. When enabling caching, the settings are stored in local storage (if enabled) When disable caching, all stored settings are removed from local storage

    Parameters

    • enable: boolean

      true to enable, false to disable.

    • Optional key: string

      the local storage key for storing media settings (if enabled). Default value is 'oneplayerjs_media_settings'

    Returns any

enableLogs

  • enableLogs(enable: boolean): any
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:40

    Enable/disable player log messages.

    Parameters

    • enable: boolean

      true to enable log messages, false to disable log messages

    Returns any

  • enableText(enable: boolean): any
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:219

    Enable/disable download and display of text tracks.

    Parameters

    • enable: boolean

      true to enable text tracks, false to disable

    Returns any

    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:187

    Returns the current buffer level for a given media type

    Parameters

    • type: MediaType

      the media type

    Returns number

    the current buffer level in ms of the selected track of the given media type

getDuration

  • getDuration(): number
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:135

    Returns the duration of the media's playback, in seconds. For live a stream, it returns the duration of the DVR window if available, Number.Infinity otherwise

    Returns number

getTime

  • getTime(): number
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:147

    Returns the current time of the playhead. For a live stream, it returns the time within the DVR window (see getDuration() method) if available, the absolute media time otherwise.

    Returns number

init

  • init(videoElement: HTMLElement, ttmlRenderingDiv?: HTMLDivElement): Promise<void>
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:27

    Initialize the player.

    Parameters

    • videoElement: HTMLElement

      the HTML5 video element used to decode and render the media data

    • Optional ttmlRenderingDiv: HTMLDivElement

      the HTML5 div to render rich TTML subtitles

    Returns Promise<void>

    a promise which is resolved once player is initialized, or rejected if player failed to initialize

load

  • load(stream: StreamInfo, loadPlugins?: boolean): any
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:85

    Load/open a video stream and start playback.

    Parameters

    • stream: StreamInfo

      input stream properties

    • Optional loadPlugins: boolean

      true to signal to plugin a new stream is being to be loaded, false otherwise (true by default)

    Returns any

    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:101

    Seek the media to the new time. For LIVE streams, this function can be used to perform seeks within the DVR window if available.

    Parameters

    • time: number

      the new time value in seconds

    Returns any

    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:195

    • id: string

    Returns any

setPlaybackSpeed

  • setPlaybackSpeed(speed: number): any
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:110

    Sets the speed/rate at which the media shall being played back. A value of 1.0 indicates normal playback speed. For values superior to normal speed or negative values (speeds between -1 and 0 are not supported), the player will perform fast forward or rewind playback. When playback is not in normal speed, the media element is muted.

    Parameters

    • speed: number

      the new playback speed

    Returns any

showDebug

  • showDebug(show: boolean, debugRenderingDiv?: HTMLDivElement): any
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:245

    Displays over video element the advanced debug/metrics window

    Parameters

    • show: boolean

      true to display the advanced debug/metrics window, false to hide/remove it

    • Optional debugRenderingDiv: HTMLDivElement

      the HTML5 div into which to render debug/metrics window. If not provided, the debug/metrics window will be appended as a child of the video element's parent element.

    Returns any

stop

  • stop(reset?: boolean, stopPlugins?: boolean): any
    • Defined in src/IPlayer.ts:123

    Stops/reset the playback of the video stream.

    Parameters

    • Optional reset: boolean

      true to reset current stream playback, false otherwise in order to pause playback and seek back to beginning of the content (true by default, false enabled only fo on-demand contents)

    • Optional stopPlugins: boolean

      true to signal to plugin the stream is being to be stopped, false otherwise (true by default)

    Returns any
